content: be sure to check out the other patterns in my fall into autumn collection 2 * favorite cable headband 1 * favorite cable mitts 2 and don t forget about the og fall into autumn collection 3 we all have that go-to beanie that we reach for time and time again when it gets chilly out this one is mine and i m sure it will become yours too the combination of the thick folded brim and the tightly woven lattice cables creates a dense heavy fabric that will keep you warm no matter the weather i would recommend this pattern to intermediate knitters who have experience working with cables the yarn i used for this pattern is stitch please chunky by premier yarns 4 i ve tried so many wool yarns over the years and they re often scratchy and uncomfortable to wear not this one it s 100% wool yet it feels soft and luxurious to the touch and it comes in so many beautiful colors to choose from the best part is that it s extremely affordable to fit any budget give it a try you ll love it ***materials*** * approx 150-180 yards 118 m of heavy worsted 4 to light bulky 5 yarn i used a little over 1 skein of stitch please chunky 5 in the color rust in the wind * us 9 5 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge as well as size 9 dpns for the decreases dpns optional if you use magic loop * us 7 4 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles for the brim optional * cable needle or double-pointed needle * common notions such as locking stitch markers yarn needle and scissors ***measurements*** approx 20 in 51 cm around and 8 in 20 5 cm tall with the brim folded up ***gauge*** 17 sts x 21 row = 4 in stockinette stitch ***disclaimer*** you are more than welcome to sell anything you make using this pattern i just ask that you credit me as the designer you may not
